Citation maintenance. Added: day. Formatted: month. You can [[WP:DOI|use this bot]] yourself! Please [[User:DOI_bot/bugs|report any bugs]].
/* Causes */ cross-disciplinary big-picture of the numerous reasons that cancer occurs and exists
Use a more-concise and (I hope) clearer caption for the lead image.
/* Immunotherapy */ Add illustration of a renal cell carcinoma here, since this section talks about that.
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
unreferenced sections such as "Screening" and others
Image removed from top panel for two reasons - 1) It doesn't reflect all types of cancer accurately 2) It's terrifying to an irresponsible degree.
Some cleanups after the Citation bot (not all of which were the bot's fault).
Citation maintenance. Added: day. Formatted: pages, pmid. You can [[WP:DOI|use this bot]] yourself! Please [[User:DOI_bot/bugs|report any bugs]].
Fixing [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|links to disambiguation pages]] using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Bring back "location" and "histology". Try not to put the word "cancer" in a section header, as per manual of style.
/* Modifiable ("lifestyle") risk factors */ rm last sentence, replace with a link at the top using [[Template:See also]]
/* History */ added wiki link to Egypt.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 270122219 by [[Special:Contributions/Eubulides|Eubulides]] ([[User talk:Eubulides|talk]]) Undo my previous change; Firefox 2 is probably not worth worrying about any more.
/* References */ Go back to 1-column: the long DOIs cause problems with older Firefox versions.
/* Epidemiology */ Move this section to a new article [[Epidemiology of cancer]], replacing it with a brief summary.
/* Epidemiology */ Summarize Danaei et al. 2005 a bit more accurately, focusing on the leading risk factors found.
/* Epidemiology */ Move epidemiology material here, from "Prevention".
Move images so that they don't all stack up on the right at the start of the article. See [[Talk:Cancer #Improvement suggestions]]. Improve captions so that they're more readable to non-experts.
/* Screening */ Discussion seems to be over, so remove template suggesting a subarticle.
/* References */ Use colwidth=30em, to better support extra-wide or extra-narrow browser windows.
/* External links */ Replace with dmoz link and {{NoMoreLinks}}, as per [[WP:LINKFARM]]. See [[Talk:Cancer #External links section]].
/* See also */ Remove, moving otherwise-uncited wikilinks into the main text. See [[Talk:Cancer #Improvement suggestions]].
Reorder sections, and retitle "Pathophysiology" to "Mechanism" and "Research" to "Research directions", as suggested in [[Talk:Cancer #Improvement suggestions]].
/* Cancer cell biology */ Don't specify a size smaller than 300px, since the user might default the size to 300px.
/* Cancer cell biology */ Omit ineffective "|right" in image (it's overridden by the "|left").
/* History */ Move history-of-epidemiology information here from "Epidemiology", as the old stuff otherwise gets in the way of the new stuff.
Added citation required on "Nearly all cancers are caused by abnormalities in the genome..."

/* Epidemiology */ Move epidemiological material here, from "Classification". Change subsection title from "Adult cancers" to "Incidence & mortality". See [[Talk:Cancer #Cancer epidemiology problems]]
Update the epidemiology statistics to the 2008 U.S. stats, and change the text to match the sources better. See [[Talk:Cancer#Cancer epidemiology problems]].
/* Support and advocacy */ add Cancer Research Institute
/* Treatment */ Double Redirect (Back to same page)

please stop - your application of the Odds algorhythm to cancer treatment seems to be [[WP:NOR]] - please discuss on talk before reinserting
this new addition constitutes NOR and contains nebulous terminology - please discuss on talk why it should be kept and what kind of source you would provide

rev.comment: clean up, typos fixed: et al → et al. using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Signs and symptoms */ Added image of symptoms
/* Signs and symptoms */ added common locations
/* Other causes */ restructure, merge with current content
Added section on Cancer's General Lack of Transmissibility
deleted the second instance of a link
/* Vaccination */ rm confused sentence - gene therapy involves gene transfer, not vaccination - also, vaccinating against an SNP would target the immune response to the entire organism, a bad idea!
/* Vaccination */ Added citation for cancer vaccine development. Copyedited first para of this section. Noted Hepatitis C vaccine.
again, that is a rather speculative theory that needs much stronger sources than a single review in Pharm Rev - please discuss on talk before citing this study again

/* Prevention */ Moved last sentence in 'Prevention' lead into the 'Modifiable' section. Added link to HPV as example of STD-based cancer. Noted possible role of inflammation citing Anand et al. 2008.
/* Prevention */ danaei makes that claim, but without the more tentative suggestion that inflammation is the final common pathway
/* Prevention */ Added statement and citation from Anand et al. 2008 claiming cancer as a largely preventable disease.
